Combat
Hit Points: 93 Initiative: 0 Armor Class: 11 Attacks Per Round: 2
Armor Proficiency: Light; Medium; Shield Weapon Proficiency: Martial Weapons; Simple Weapons
Armor: Padded Shield: None Weapons: Heavy Crossbow (+6 1d10 R100/400); Javelin (+11 1d6+5 R30/120); Mace (+11 1d6+5); Unarmed (+11 1+5)
Combat Notes:
Constitution Hit Points Adjustment: +20
Extra Attack: +1 Attacks Per Round
Lightly Armored: Armor Proficiency (Light)
Strength Attack Adjustment: +5
Strength Damage Adjustment: +5
Unarmored Defense (Barbarian): +1 Armor Class in no armor
Brutal Critical: Melee critical hits inflict 3 additional dice of damage
Demolishing Might: Melee weapons inflict x2 damage vs. objects and +1d8 HP damage vs. constructs
Feral Instinct: Has advantage on initiative/Can rage and then act when surprised
Mending Affinity: Healing and stabilization restore +6 HP
Overwhelming Cleave: May use a bonus action after attacking to attack another foe adjacent to target
Persistent Rage: Can continue raging when unengaged with any foe
Polearm Master: Can use a bonus action to attack with the butt of a polearm, inflicting 1d4 HP bludgeoning, and a foe entering polearm reach provokes an opportunity attack
Rage: +4 damage with Strength melee weapons during rage
Reckless Attack: During rage, can suffer foe advantage on attacks to gain advantage on Strength melee attacks for 1 rd
Sentinel: Successful opportunity attacks halt the target/Can take an opportunity attack when a foe uses Disengage/Can use a reaction to attack when an adjacent foe attacks another
Stance Of The Mountain: Cannot be knocked prone during rage
Thunderous Blows: May push foe 5' w/a successful attack (DC 19 Strength neg)
Unstoppable: Cannot be slowed, frightened, paralyzed, or stunned during rage; suffers 1 level of exhaustion when rage ends
Save Proficiency: Constitution; Strength
Save: Charisma: 1; Constitution: 7; Dexterity: 0; Intelligence: 1; Strength: 11; Wisdom: 1
Save Notes:
Danger Sense: Has advantage on Dexterity vs. visible dangers
Dungeon Delver: Has advantage to avoid or resist traps and resistance to trap damage
Rage: Has advantage on Strength saves and resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage during rage
Relentless Rage: Can make a DC 10 Constitution save to retain 1 hit point when brought to 0 hit points; each use adds 5 to the DC until a short rest
Magic
Magic Notes: Rage: Cannot cast or concentrate on spells during rage
